title: Jaguar jet crash: Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav cremated with full military honours

content: The Bench, however, asks the Jharkhand government to keep the power cuts to minimum level and confined to procession routes

title: From Dhanbad to Bengaluru, wells in 10 cities to get a fresh lease of life with shallow aquifers

title: President withholds assent to T.N.’s anti-NEET Bill; CM Stalin to hold all-party meeting on April 9
content: The Tamil Nadu Admission to Undergraduate Medical Degree Courses Bill was passed unanimously in the Assembly in September 2021. After the Bill was returned by the Governor, an all-party meeting was held in February 2022. The Bill was then re-adopted in the Assembly and sent for the President’s assent.

title: Wikipedia must remove India content deemed defamatory, rules Delhi High Court
content: The court will continue to hear the case, in which ANI seeks damages of about ₹2 crore and an apology from Wikimedia.

title: Pathar Pratima blast: Brother of prime accused arrested in Bengal
content: The arrested person is the brother of the prime accused, who is the owner of the firecracker manufacturing unit situated a few metres away from the house where the explosion took place

title: Quad grouping ‘coordinating efforts’ for relief to Myanmar after earthquake
content: The statement is significant for a grouping that was formed to deliver HADR assistance in the Indian Ocean Region in the aftermath of the 2004 tusnami

title: Lok Sabha adjourned sine die; Budget session concludes
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said as many as 16 Bills were passed during the session and the House productivity was pegged at over 118%

title: PM Modi to arrive in Sri Lanka on April 4 night
content: Visit to include bilateral talks at leadership and delegation levels, signing of key agreements, talks with opposition politicians; Spotlight on contentious fisheries issue, defence pact

title: West Bengal recruitment scam: Mamata Banerjee must resign, she will go to jail, says BJP

title: Avoid rhetorics that vitiates constructive relationship, urges PM Modi during talks with Bangladesh’s Yunus
content: Bangladesh Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus has spoken about Sheikh Hasina, Ganges and Teesta Water Treaty among others, in the 40 minute meeting

title: Rare long-snouted vine snake rediscovered in Dudhwa Tiger Reserve
content: The discovery was made on March 28 during a rhino release operation in the Palia Kheri division, when a vibrant green snake emerged while officials were clearing a termite mound for safety

title: U.S. revises tariff on India downwards from 27% to 26%
content: US reduces import duties on India from 27% to 26% starting April 9, reciprocal tariffs announced for other countries.

title: Waqf Bill will benefit Munambam residents, says Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: ‘Please don’t try to create any confusion. Let’s wait and see how it pans out,’ says Suresh Gopi in response to queries about whether the amendments will have retrospective effect

title: India ranks tenth with $1.4 billion private investment in Artificial Intelligence: United Nations report

title: ASI taking proactive measures to mitigate any damage to Aurangzeb’s tomb: Govt in Parliament
content: Archaeological Survey of India protects Aurangzeb’s tomb in Maharashtra with proactive measures against extremist threats.

title: Flight from London with Indian passengers diverted to Turkiye to resume Mumbai journey
content: fter receiving the necessary technical approvals, the flight will resume its onward journey to Mumbai from Diyarbakir Airport at 12:00 local time today, as per the Virgin Atlantic officials.

title: It is expected Bangladesh will ‘thoroughly investigate’ minority-related incidents: India
content: Over 2,400 minority-related incidents in Bangladesh reported, India expects thorough investigation and justice for perpetrators.

title: SIT inspects North Sentinel Island for any article left behind by arrested U.S. national
content: Officials are using binoculars in a boat while maintaining a distance to locate any article that may have been left behind by Mykhailo Polyakov and could endanger the life and safety of the indigenous Sentinelese tribe.

title: Waqf Bill: No party whip, BJD asked MPs to vote by their conscience
content: Our party, having taken these views into careful consideration, has entrusted our members in the Rajya Sabha with the responsibility of exercising their conscience in the best interest of justice, harmony and the rights of all communities,  BJD Rajya Sabha member Sasmit Patra said.

title: Munambam land dispute in Kerala: A comprehensive coverage
content: A package on the contentious Munambam land issue. The occupants of the land have been protesting demanding that the revenue rights of their holdings be restored after Kerala State Waqf Board staked its claim to the property

title: Heavy rains lash Vijayawada, thundershowers expected in parts of Andhra Pradesh
content: Alluri Sitarama Raju, Kakinada, East Godavari, Anantapur, Annamayya, and Tirupati districts are likely to receive light to moderate rainfall accompanied by thundershowers.

title: Congress to challenge Waqf Bill soon in Supreme Court
content: Congress to challenge constitutionality of Wakf (Amendment) Bill, 2024 in Supreme Court, resisting Modi Govt’s assaults on Constitution.

title: PM Modi, Muhammad Yunus seated together at BIMSTEC dinner in Thailand

title: Samastha mouthpiece slams Priyanka Gandhi’s absence in Lok Sabha during discussion, voting on Waqf Bill
content: In an editorial, Suprabhatham says Priyanka Gandhi’s non-attendance from Lok Sabha violated Congress’ whip and that the question of why Rahul Gandhi did not speak against the divisive Bill will also ‘reverberate through eternity’

title: Fire breaks out at Andhra Pradesh Secretariat at Velagapudi
content: The extent of damage is yet to be ascertained. No staff members were inside the offices at the time of the outbreak

title: Ready to help, PM Modi tells Myanmar’s Senior General as his country recovers from earthquake
content: Prime Minister Modi meets Myanmar’s Senior General Min at BIMSTEC Summit to discuss earthquake relief efforts and regional connectivity.

title: It’s turtle time in coastal Karnataka
content: Hundreds of sea turtles, mainly Olive Ridleys, flock to Karnataka’s beaches to lay eggs during December-March, mainly in Uttara Kannada

title: Ranga Shankara to celebrate Ugadi with Kathaa Kaala
content: Every year, Ranga Shankara marks Ugadi with a special event called Ranga Yugadi, that celebrates the literary richness of Karnataka

title: Night squads against drug abuse urged not to take law into hands
content: Four residents’ associations at Thykoodam near Vyttila have joined hands to form night squads to combat drug menace; EDRAAC asks them not to encroach on the domain of law enforcement agencies or resort to physically assaulting suspects

title: A risky jab and HIV threat put Kerala’s Valanchery in alert mode
content: The news that 10 injecting drug users in a local body in Malappuram district have tested positive for Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) has come as a rude shock to the State. Abdul Latheef Naha tracks the risky behaviour of drug users to find out how the practice has put their lives in peril, besides upsetting the health plans of the State

title: NHRC issues notice to Assam Govt. over detention of journalist

title: Passage of Waqf (Amendment) Bill a watershed moment in collective quest for socio-economic justice, says PM Modi
content: “For decades, the Waqf system was synonymous with lack of transparency and accountability,” said the Prime Minister

title: Uttarakhand HC orders unsealing of madrasa on condition that it won’t run without registration
content: In the order, the High Court noted that the property was sealed without any show-cause notice and even the petitioners were not given any opportunity of hearing

title: CPI(M) demands cancellation of land allotted to LuLu Group on Vizag Beach Road
content: The government would lease out land for 99 years, bear registration charges and provide amenities to the private party, which is a waste of public money, say the party leaders

title: Cost of a turf war in Vijayawada’s Besant Road
content: Vijayawada’s historic business hub, Besant Road simmers with tension as shop owners and hawkers vie for its lucrative turf. Nellore Sravani navigates the chaotic and congested street, uncovering a standoff that is threatening livelihoods and smothering a city’s economic artery

title: Central team visits Andhra Pradesh’s Narasaraopeta to probe two-year-old’s death due to bird flu
content: The death of the child occurred on March 16; a survey in three villages however, found no sign of the disease in poultry

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. notifies bird flu outbreak in six districts
content: The officials had ordered culling of lakhs of broiler and layer birds and also backyard poultry in West Godavari, East Godavari, Kurnool, Eluru, NTR and Kakinada districts

title: Ragging in Telangana medical colleges: A rite of passage or a lifetime of scars?
content: Despite anti-ragging laws, medical colleges in Telangana remain hotspots for hazing. From verbal humiliation to physical abuse, first-year students endure unspoken harassment, fearing retaliation and institutional indifference. Weak enforcement, deep-rooted power dynamics and poor mental health support keep the vicious cycle alive. Siddharth Kumar Singh investigates why ragging persists despite policies meant to end it

title: Assam CM lauds Amit Shah for Lok Sabha address on Waqf
content: Union Home Minister has demonstrated the courage and resolute determination of a ‘new India’, says Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Union Minister Piyush Goyal asks startups to focus on high-tech sectors like robotics and AI
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal urges Indian startups to shift focus to high tech sectors, emphasizing need for domestic investments.

title: Parliament passes Protection of Interests in Aircraft Objects Bill
content: Replying to the discussion on the bill, Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu said the bill will help improve the cost efficiency for airlines as well as in faster expansion of their fleets through leasing of aircraft.

title: Data show Sanskrit and Hindi are choices for third language in many Indian schools
content: Data hint that Sanskrit and Hindi are preferred by default due to a lack of supply and demand, even if they are not imposed

title: Richer States could lose political clout in population-based delimitation
content: To frame this discussion as a north-south divide is inaccurate. This debate is about regional disparities

title: Chennai’s residential market recorded 10% year on year growth
content: According to Knight Frank India, 4,357 units were sold during the first quarter of 2025. New launches also saw an uptick, with 4,576 units introduced, reflecting a 5% year-on-year growth

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) MLA accuses Fadnavis Govt. of stalling development projects in Dharashiv
content: MLA Kailas Patil claims on X that Dharashiv district collector had earlier received  directive from the Maharashtra government instructing officials to put administrative sanction of development projects on hold until further notice

content: According to the Jabalpur Police, the incident took place on March 31 inside the Ranjhi Police Station premises when officers were inquiring about allegations by the VHP about forced religious conversion

title: Bengaluru’s Namma Metro: India’s priciest transit
content: After the fare revision, commuting by Bengaluru’s Namma Metro has become the most expensive service in the country, with the ticket cost surpassing those in Delhi, Chennai, and other major cities. The Hindu Darshan Devaiah B.P. compares metro fares and other parameters across the country and explains how Bengaluru Metro became the costliest transit service

title: Home Ministry holds tripartite meeting to resolve issues related to Gorkhas
content: The meeting was chaired by Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai who assured the participants that the Centre would resolve the long-standing issues of Gorkhas

title: Curry, Podziemski overwhelm Lakers in Warriors' win
content: With playoff positioning on the line, the Lakers and Warriors squared off in a Western Conference showdown.

title: Morant uses finger-gun gesture despite warning
content: Grizzlies guard Ja Morant risked further action from the NBA after mimicking shooting a gun with his finger during Thursday night's 110-108 win at the Heat.

title: Sources: PGA Tour rejects PIF's recent $1.5B offer
content: The PGA Tour has rejected PIF's most recent offer to invest $1.5 billion into PGA Tour Enterprises, the tour's for-profit entity, which came with the caveat that the rival LIV Golf League would remain intact, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Luka takes blame for 'unacceptable' night in loss
content: Luka Doncic was short and to the point in describing his cold shooting in the Lakers' 123-116 loss the Warriors on Thursday, calling it an "unacceptable" performance.

title: Giannis' NBA 1st of 35-17-20 keys Bucks' victory
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo became the first player in NBA history to have 35 points, 17 rebounds and a career-high 20 assists as the Bucks beat the 76ers 126-113 Thursday night.

title: LSU star Johnson to skip WNBA draft, source says
content: LSU star guard Flau'Jae Johnson is opting to skip the 2025 WNBA draft and will return to college basketball for her senior season, a source told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Man who conned ex-NBA star Howard gets 12 yrs.
content: A 50-year-old Georgia businessman was sentenced to more than 12 years in federal prison for scamming former NBA players Dwight Howard and Chandler Parsons out of millions of dollars.

title: Chattanooga claims 1st NIT crown after OT thriller
content: Chattanooga became the first team from the Southern Conference to win the NIT championship after beating UC Irvine 85-84.

title: Dodgers' Freeman placed on IL after shower slip
content: Dodgers first baseman Freddie Freeman, who slipped and fell in the shower on Sunday morning, was put on the injured list for his ankle injury.

content: Ahead of the Final Four, NBA execs share their comparisons for the Duke star and projected No. 1 draft pick.

content: Following a 1-0 defeat at the hands of Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur's Ange Postecoglou is running out of options to save his team's disappointing season.

content: Ange Postecolgou has said his actions were misinterpreted after the Tottenham Hotspur head coach appeared to cup his ear and wave in the direction of the travelling Spurs fans.

title: Parsons: USWNT's Thompson best in NWSL in '25
content: Angel City FC sporting director Mark Parsons said forward Alyssa Thompson has set the standard in the opening weeks of the 2025 National Women's Soccer League season.

title: FIFA rankings: USMNT static, Canada at new high
content: The USMNT remained at 16th in the latest FIFA rankings released Thursday, while Canada climbed to a new all-time high and Mexico moved up two spots following last month's Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: UEFA boss: 64-team men's World Cup 'a bad idea'
content: A push to expand the men's 2030 World Cup to 64 teams is "a bad idea," UEFA president Aleksander Čeferin said on Thursday.

title: U.S. to get '31 Women's World Cup; U.K. in '35
content: Gianni Infantino said the United States and the United Kingdom are poised to be named as hosts of the Women's World Cup in 2031 and 2035, respectively.

title: Barça win appeal, Olmo, Víctor cleared to play
content: Spain's sports ministry (CSD) have ruled that Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor can continue to play for Barcelona until the end of the season.

title: Arsenal CB Gabriel's season over, surgery due
content: Arsenal defender Gabriel Magalhaes requires surgery on his hamstring injury and will miss the rest of the season as a result.

title: Zambia drop 4 NWSL stars, cite U.S. travel rules
content: The Zambia women's national team have removed their four U.S.-based players from the squad for the Yongchuan International Tournament in China due to concerns over U.S. travel measures, the Zambia FA said on Wednesday.

title: Life after OMG: Can 2025 Mets replicate their 2024 vibes?
content: After signing a superstar but losing a pop star, the Mets aim to make Citi Field twist again like it did last summer.

title: First impressions from the Athletics' new home opener
content: How the players, fans and staff handled the first of many games in their minor league stadium residency.

content: It wasn't just about a polarizing on-field rule. It was a window into the back-channel politics of the rules process.

title: Ranking the best running backs in college football for 2025
content: From a CFP standout and a pair of teammates to two impact freshmen, here are our picks for the top 10 RBs.

title: How one tryout sent Shavon Revel on his way from a warehouse job to the NFL's doorstep
content: After struggling at juco and working at Amazon, the ECU corner changed it all at a tryout camp on one hour's sleep.

content: Pittsburgh executives are feeling good about their chances with Rodgers, but could Minnesota still be in play?

title: League meeting: QB options, draft maneuvers, roster holes
content: Annual meetings wrapped up Tuesday, and more than 20 of our reporters on the ground had all the news.

title: Far from the March Madness spotlight, college hoops grapples with a gambling problem
content: All eyes are on the Final Four, but college athletics officials are worried about suspicious bets on games featuring smaller schools.

title: Florida center Olivier Rioux enjoys Final Four experience from record-breaking vantage point
content: The Florida Gators' redshirt freshman is the world's tallest teenager, according to the Guinness Book of World Records.

title: Why the Manchester derby lost its cachet, and how it might be coming back around
content: Sunday's Manchester derby will be lowest-key edition in some time. How did we get here, and when might it get back to the thrilling match-up it once was?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea look to sign Borussia winger Gittens
content: Could Chelsea's next move be for Borussia Dortmund winger Jamie Gittens? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Waqf Bill sparks rift within JD(U) as fifth leader quits party
content: Not one or two but at least five leaders submitted their resignations as the bill was passed, first in Lok Sabha and then the Rajya Sabha on Thursday and Friday, respectively.  ​The latest to resign from the party was Nadeem Akhtar, his resignation follows that of four other leaders, including JD(U) leader Raju Nayyar, Tabrez Siddiqui Alig, Mohammad Shahnawaz Malik, and Mohammed Kasim Ansari.

title: 'Rishabh Pant is yet to ... ': Sanjiv Goenka's huge take on LSG skipper
content: Following LSG's eight-wicket loss to PBKS in the 2025 IPL, owner Sanjiv Goenka expressed strong faith in skipper Rishabh Pant's leadership. He emphasised Pant's instinct-driven style and potential for growth. Despite a tough game, Goenka encouraged the team to believe in themselves for future matches. LSG aims to bounce back against Mumbai Indians.

title: Zepto CEO replies to 'happy being delivery boys and girls': ‘still far away from…’
content: Aadit Palicha, co-founder of Zepto, defended the contributions of consumer internet startups in response to Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's remarks. Palicha highlighted Zepto's creation of 1.5 lakh jobs, significant tax contributions, and investments in backend supply chains, while acknowledging the need for more foundational technological advancements in India.

title: Incidents of temples being defaced on rise in US: MEA
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has expressed serious concerns over the increasing incidents of anti-India graffiti defacing Hindu temples in the US. Diplomatic channels are actively addressing these hate crimes, with US authorities investigating and treating them as severe offenses. Members of US Congress have also advocated for broader strategies to counteract these hate crimes against Hindus.

title: 'No rocket science': Ashish Nehra reveals his coaching philosophy at GT
content: Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra stresses the importance of stability and simplicity in coaching. He aims to create a relaxed environment for players. Nehra supports captain Shubman Gill and believes in his potential to lead the team. He highlights the need for chemistry in frequently changing squads, focusing on the basics and personal growth.

title: USCIS' message to H1-B, Green Card visa applicants: There are only two...
content: USCIS has revised its policy to recognize only two biological sexes, male and female, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. Effective April 2, this change applies to all immigration benefit requests. The determination of sex will be based on birth certificates, and discrepancies may lead to processing delays.

title: Protests erupt in Kolkata, Ahmedabad after passage of Waqf Bill
content: In Kolkata and Ahmedabad, protesters rallied against the Waqf Amendment Bill after Friday prayers, blocking roads and voicing their opposition. The bill, passed in the Rajya Sabha, makes changes such as reducing mandatory contributions and introducing state auditors. It awaits the President's nod to become law. Supporters claim it improves transparency, while critics see it as impinging on religious autonomy.

title: Setback for Tamil Nadu as Centre declines consent for anti-NEET bill
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced that the Centre has rejected the state's Assembly resolution seeking NEET exemption. Despite submitting all necessary clarifications, the Union government declined the request. Stalin condemned the decision and scheduled an all-party meeting for April 9 to discuss future actions, describing it as a setback for federalism.

title: Punjabi songs, luxury bags and a Thar: How cop mocked own force in reels
content: Punjab police constable Amandeep Kaur was dismissed for violating professional norms by posting social media videos in uniform and was subsequently arrested for possessing heroin. The action came amid a state anti-drug campaign, with police finding 17.71 grams of heroin during a search of her vehicle.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has defended the intense work ethic required for startup success, emphasizing that employees needed to continue working after family dinners during the company's early days. Hoffman argues that work-life balance is not feasible in startups, highlighting the significant rewards for those who embrace the demanding culture.

title: Why Sensex has crashed over 900 points - top 4 reasons
content: Indian stock market indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, suffered significant declines on Friday, triggered by US recession fears and new tariffs announced by American President Donald Trump.

title: Woman says feeling 'so safe' in Delhi, appreciates cab driver's kind gesture
content: A heartwarming story from Delhi where a Rapido driver helped a woman in distress by offering support and ensuring her safety. She struggled to book a ride without a phone, but the driver stayed with her until she reached her accommodation safely. This act of kindness has inspired many on social media, highlighting the existence of good people.

title: Salman Khan starrer 'Sikandar' less likely to cross Rs 100 crore
content: Salman Khan's film 'Sikandar' had a lower-than-expected opening, earning Rs 26 crore on its first day. Despite releasing prior to Eid, it failed to show significant growth, collecting Rs 29 crore on Eid. By day 6, the film's total stood at Rs 90.66 crore.

title: 'Unfortunate': LS Speaker Birla slams Sonia over Waqf Bill 'bulldozed' remark
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla criticised Sonia Gandhi's comments on the Waqf Amendment Bill, calling them "unfortunate" and undermining parliamentary democracy. Despite extensive discussions and proper procedures, Birla noted her allegations were inappropriate. Sonia Gandhi claimed the bill undermined democratic values and was pushed through forcibly, sparking debate between the government and opposition.

title: ‘There will be blood’: Is the world staring at a recession?
content: Economic forecasts show growing recession fears as Donald Trump's new tariff announcements dampen global business sentiment and disrupt supply chains. Major financial institutions like JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs have significantly increased the likelihood of a recession, while the S&P 500 has experienced severe market losses.

title: Social media has a field day over Trump’s tariff on uninhabited island
content: In an unexpected move, President Trump imposed a 10% tariff on US trading partners, amusingly including the uninhabited Heard and McDonald Islands of Australia. This decision sparked online satire and drew a mixed reply from Australia, with the tariffs affecting other territories like Norfolk Island more severely.

title: Crops under threat as surprise March heatwave hit Central Asia: Study
content: A surprise heatwave hit Central Asia in March, a new study published Friday showed, putting in danger crops and water supply in a largely rural region already heavily affected by the impacts of climate change.  "Hotter March temperatures are impacting agriculture harvests and access to water in Central Asia, as well as people's health," said Friederike Otto, co-head of World Weather Attribution.

title: Trump admin revises reciprocal tariffs for 14 countries including India - Full list
content: US President Donald Trump’s announcement of reciprocal tariffs revealed discrepancies between the displayed charts and the White House annexure. The White House has now amended the annex to match the lower rates initially shown. The revised rates will impact numerous countries with differential tariffs being applied from April 5.

title: $2.4tn shock: How US stocks 'boomed' after Trump tariff surgery- 10 big numbers
content: Wall Street experienced its largest one-day loss since the start of Covid due to new US tariffs announced by President Trump. The S&P 500 lost $2.4 trillion in value, with significant declines in tech and retail sectors. Analysts predict increases in household costs and an escalating trade conflict.

title: BJP functionary found dead, blames Congress MLA in social media post
content: Vinay Somaiah, a 35-year-old BJP functionary, was found hanging in his office in Bengaluru. Before his death, Vinay had accused a Congress functionary of abetting his suicide following an arrest and FIR against him for comments made on a WhatsApp group.

title: Sacked for heroin possession, cop flaunted luxury cars on Instagram
content: Punjab Police constable Amandeep Kaur was arrested with 17.7 grams of heroin and subsequently dismissed from service for defying departmental orders. Kaur often flaunted her uniform and luxurious lifestyle on social media, violating policies intended to maintain professionalism within the force.

title: Who developed Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff formula? Mystery continues
content: US President Donald Trump has announced significant tariffs on trade partners to address trade imbalances. Conflicting accounts regarding the formula's origin add to the confusion, but it’s attributed to the Council of Economic Advisers and the US Trade Representative. The move raises concerns of a potential trade war.

title: Exclusive: 'Cricket flooded with numbers, at times too much' - Buttler
content: Jos Buttler, former England captain, shared his experiences with the Gujarat Titans and his career evolution. He discussed batting order roles, the use of data in cricket, and influence of other sports. Buttler hopes to continue playing international cricket despite stepping down as captain after England's recent disappointing ICC event results.

title: KKR's Iyer smiles at question on price-tag pressure
content: KKR's Venkatesh Iyer addresses the question on whether being the team's costliest player at Rs 23.75 crore leads to pressure, asserting that the focus is on team's performance instead of individual scores. After modest show in the first two matches of the season, his impactful 60-run knock led to an 80-run victory against Sunrisers Hyderabad.

title: ED searches premises of 'Empuraan' producer over foreign exchange violations
content: The Enforcement Directorate searched locations linked to Kerala-based businessman Gokulam Gopalan for alleged foreign exchange violations. The investigation, under FEMA, includes Chennai and Kochi premises. Gopalan is involved in producing the film "L2: Empuraan", which has faced criticism and received an apology from actor Mohanlal for controversial content.

title: 'I am truly sorry': South Korea's Yoon after being removed from office
content: South Korea’s Constitutional Court upheld President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment, officially removing him from office for declaring martial law. The court found Yoon's actions violated the constitution. His removal ignited strong reactions and sets the stage for fresh elections amid ongoing political tensions.

title: 'Will resist assaults of Modi govt': Cong to challenge Waqf Bill in SC
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh announced the party's intent to challenge the constitutionality of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in the Supreme Court following its passage in both houses of Parliament. The bill faced opposition from several parties, while Prime Minister Modi lauded it as a move towards transparency and socio-economic justice, especially benefiting marginalized Muslim communities.

title: 'Not everyone can afford air purifier': Why SC upheld cracker ban in NCR
content: Supreme Court upholds the ban on the sale and manufacture of firecrackers, including green ones, in the National Capital Region, citing the right to health under Article 21. The court noted that the impact of air pollution is severe on the common man, particularly those who can't afford air purifiers.

title: Private school staffer molests 10 girls in Maharashtra
content: An assistant teacher at a private school in Akola was arrested for molesting 10 girl students while their female teachers were away. The incident was reported to the school authorities by the aggrieved parents, leading to immediate police action and the involvement of the Child Helpline.

title: Veteran actor-director Manoj Kumar, known as Bharat Kumar, bids farewell at 87
content: Renowned actor and filmmaker Manoj Kumar, popularly known as 'Bharat Kumar,' passed away at 87 after a prolonged illness. Known for his patriotic films like Shaheed, Upkar, and Roti Kapda Aur Makaan, Kumar left a significant impact on Indian cinema. Fellow filmmaker Ashoke Pandit confirmed the news, expressing that the industry will greatly miss him.

title: We have food apps, China has AI, EV: Piyush Goyal's startup reality check
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the disparity between Indian and Chinese startups, emphasizing that while Indian startups focus on food delivery and fantasy sports apps, Chinese startups concentrate on advanced technologies like EVs, AI, and semiconductors. He called for more domestic investment and innovation in the Indian startup ecosystem.

title: 'Murderer': Protests erupt in Bangkok as Myanmar junta chief attends summit
content: Myanmar's junta leader Min Aung Hlaing faces protests at a regional summit in Bangkok, as his country reels from a deadly 7.7-magnitude earthquake. Despite international aid efforts, the military's response remains lacking, with survivors struggling for basic necessities amid ongoing military offensives.

title: Watch: PM Modi shares highlights from 'action-packed' first day in Thailand
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the sixth Bimstec Summit in Bangkok, where he discussed key areas of cooperation with Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra. Modi also attended cultural events, highlighting the shared cultural ties between India and Thailand, including a performance of the Thai Ramayana.

title: LSG vs MI: Struggling Rohit, Pant face the music
content: Lucknow Super Giants and Mumbai Indians face off in a crucial game at the Ekana Stadium with Rishabh Pant and Rohit Sharma under scrutiny for their poor form. LSG seek to regain momentum, while MI aim to capitalize after their win over KKR.

title: Is it 26% or 27%? Trump’s reciprocal tariffs on India revised downward
content: White House has revised downward to 26% the reciprocal tariff on India from an initially published 27%. Several countries experienced their rates varying slightly before final rates were confirmed.

title: MP youth falls into well, 7 jump one by one to save him, all die
content: Eight villagers suffocated to death in a well in Khandwa, MP, while attempting to rescue one another after one person fell in. Toxic gases from contamination in the well are suspected to have caused the deaths. The well, used only for idol immersions, turned deadly due to accumulated muck. Each victim's family will receive Rs 4 lakh in compensation.

title: "Any Rhetoric...": PM's Message To Bangladesh Leader After Northeast Remark
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Muhammad Yunus, chief advisor of Bangladesh's interim government, are meeting on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC Summit in Bangkok

title: In NEET Row, Setback For Tamil Nadu After Centre Nixes Exemption Bill
content: Tamil Nadu's battle for exemption from NEET - the all-India entrance test for admission to medical courses - suffered a setback Friday after President Droupadi Murmu rejected a bill to exclude the state and allow it to use Class XII marks.

title: Bengaluru Man Dies By Suicide, Blames Congress For Death In Suicide Note
content: A 35-year-old man was found dead by suicide in his office in Bengaluru's Nagawara area on Friday. In a letter, he alleged that a politically motivated FIR, orchestrated by a local Congress leader, forced him to die by suicide.

title: "Everything Will Be Finished": Sacked Teachers Target Bengal Government
content: The Supreme Court judgment cancelling the appointment of more than 25,000 teachers and other school staff in West Bengal has sparked a massive political row, with the ruling Trinamool Congress and the Opposition BJP and CPM trading barbs.

title: BJP Demands Sonia Gandhi's Apology For Waqf Bill Remarks
content: The BJP has demanded an apology from Congress leader Sonia Gandhi over her remarks on the Waqf Bill.Mrs Gandhi termed the Waqf Bill a "brazen assault" on the Constitution.

title: Veteran Bollywood Actor Manoj Kumar Dies At 87 In Mumbai
content: Veteran actor Manoj Kumar was admitted to Kokilaben Dhirubai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai, where he died due to heart-related complications.

title: "Political Leader, Not A Terrorist": Yasin Malik To Supreme Court
content: Jailed JKLF chief Yasin Malik said in the Supreme Court that he was a "political leader and not a terrorist" and claimed seven Prime Ministers had engaged in a dialogue with him in the past.

title: Billionaires Lost $208 Billion After Tariff Announcement, Biggest Loser Is...
content: The drop is the fourth-largest one-day decline in the Billionaires Index's 13-year history, and the largest since the peak of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Instagram Popular Punjab Constable Amandeep Kaur Caught With 17 Grams Heroin
content: Senior woman constable Amandeep Kaur was arrested amid the Punjab government's ongoing anti-drug drive, 'Yudh Nasheyan Virudh.'

title: This US Man Reached North Sentinel Island In 2018. He Was Killed By Tribe
content: The Sentinelese tribe is extremely protective of their island and has no contact with the outside world.

title: Opinion: Why Does Your AI 'Ghibli' Look So Terrible? Because It Is
content: What happens when AI conjures art out of thin air while completely isolating the user from the process? You get what is, essentially, just an artefact, minus the artistry. A hunk of butter that's all hunk and no butter.

title: Couple Dance, Then Heart Attack: 25th Wedding Anniversary Party Turns Fatal
content: A couple's 25th wedding anniversary turned into mourning in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly when the man collapsed after suffering a heart attack.

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .

title: KKR Mock Travis Head, Target SRH Star In Avoidable Social Media Post
content: Kolkata Knight Riders didn't spare Travis Head on social media after the Sunrisers Hyderabad star departed for 4 runs.

title: Rare Snake Rediscovered In Dudhwa Tiger Reserve, 2nd Sighting In India
content: A rare long-snouted vine snake (Ahaetulla longirostris) has been rediscovered in the Dudhwa Tiger Reserve here, marking its first documented sighting in the state and only the second recorded instance in India, forest officials said.

title: Opinion: Why Does Your AI 'Ghibli' Look So Terrible? Because It Is
content: What happens when AI conjures art out of thin air while completely isolating the user from the process? You get what is, essentially, just an artefact, minus the artistry. A hunk of butter that's all hunk and no butter.

title: Inside one prospect's 'storybook' journey from Egypt to the NFL draft
content: AHMED HASSANEIN 'S JOURNEY to the doorstep of the NFL began on a balcony seven years ago in Cairo . his sisters, brother and nephew, Gigi and Aziza Ibrahim, told Hassanein's older brother, Cory Besch, about his life over the past decade after moving from California at age 6 . he had forgotten how to speak English, had behavioral issues that caused him to be expelled from school .

title: 'Everybody has to run their own race': Will Thibs' strategy doom the minutes-heavy Knicks?
content: the Minnesota Timberwolves set a modern NBA record by blowing 22 double-digit leads . coach and team president Tom Thibodeau was crystal clear in diagnosing the issue . despite a slew of teams leaning into the league's load-management strategy, the Wolves did the opposite .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Jets take over the top spot, plus every team's performance vs. projections
content: the blues beat the Penguins for their 11th win in a row . there are less than two weeks left in the 2024-25 NHL regular season . the playoff field continues to be whittled down, with teams clinching berths .

title: Ranking the 15 best players: From Bueckers and Betts to Paopao and Strong
content: the top 15 players in women's college basketball will compete in the final four . "nBA Today" has ranked the top players in men's basketball throughout the season . it's time to see the very best on the biggest stage . the WNBA draft pick is in her fourth final Four .

title: Power Rankings: Who are the top teams one week into the season?
content: the Dodgers and Padres are undefeated, while a team with lofty expectations in the Braves are winless to start the season . we've seen both great individual performances -- Aaron Judge ' walk-off three-run blast' and not so great ones -- Rafael Devers' historic strikeout streak .

title: When Manoj Kumar Filed Defamation Charges Against Shah Rukh Khan
content: a scene of the film did "offend" film veteran Manoj Kumar . he apologised for hurting the veteran actor's sentiment . the actor said he should have been over-careful .

title: 'Jaiswal Kicked Rahane's Kitbag', Friction Between Stars Behind Goa Move
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal reveals that he is shifting to goa due to new opportunities . the 23-year-old will play for goa from the 2025-26 season . jaiswal says he will be indebted to the governing body .
